IndexPage.title: Code for Taiwan
IndexPage.subtitle: Building Digital Infrastructure for a Better Society
IndexPage.description: We are a civic tech community dedicated to creating open-source solutions that improve government transparency, civic engagement, and public services.

hero.headline: Technology for Social Good
hero.subheadline: Join us in building a more transparent and participatory democracy through technology

about.title: Building a Better Taiwan Through Technology and Collaboration
about.subtitle: Through collaborative civic tech development, we promote transparency, accountability, and civic engagement in Taiwan.

open_source.title: Open Source
open_source.description: All projects are open source and welcome contributions from the community

transparency.title: Government Transparency

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about Code for Taiwan

questions.question: What is Code for Taiwan?
questions.answer: Code for Taiwan is a civic tech community dedicated to solving social problems through open-source technology, promoting government transparency and civic engagement. We bring together technologists, designers, and citizens who care about society to create meaningful digital solutions.

questions.question: Can I participate without a technical background?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We welcome participants from all backgrounds. Besides engineers and designers, we also need skills in project management, content editing, community management, policy research, and more. Everyone can contribute to improving Taiwan's digital infrastructure.

questions.question: How can I start participating in Code for Taiwan projects?
questions.answer: You can start by attending our hackathon events, joining our Slack discussion groups, or directly checking out our open-source projects on GitHub. We regularly host beginner-friendly workshops to help everyone get familiar with our collaboration process.

questions.question: Are all Code for Taiwan projects free?
questions.answer: Yes, all our projects are open source and freely available to the public. We believe transparency and openness are core values of a democratic society, so our code, data, and resources are open to everyone.

questions.question: How can I contact the Code for Taiwan team?
questions.answer: You can reach us through our official website, social media platforms, or by directly attending our physical events. We also welcome you to join our online community to discuss and exchange ideas with other participants.

join.title: Join Our Community
join.description: Participate in community activities through various channels and work together with like-minded partners for Taiwan's digital democracy.

section.title: Join Our Team
section.description: Whether you're a developer, designer, or a citizen concerned about social issues, we welcome your participation. Let's use technology to make Taiwan better together!

Footer.tagline: Building a better Taiwan through technology and collaboration.

PathnamesPage.description:
The pathnames are internationalized too.

If you're using the default language English, you'll see /en/pathnames in the browser address bar on this page.

If you change the locale to German, the URL is localized accordingly (/de/pfadnamen).
PathnamesPage.title: Pathnames
